intro: Bilabrella humilior, commonly known as the low bilabrella, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are usually oval in shape. It prefers moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Bilabrella humilior is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
